profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-02-04 04:53:28 -0500.

did.abstract: The New University Conference was a national, radical organization that was active on the Indiana University campus from 1968-1971. The leftist group was made up of graduate students and faculty members who were involved in causes such as educational reforms, women's liberation, anti-war, and more. The local Bloomington group was dedicated to exposing problems on the Indiana University campus, especially regarding those issues specifically connected to the national organization's overarching causes. The collection consist of records created by both the National organization and local Bloomington chapter of the New University Conference.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: According to information gleaned from the collection, the New University Conference was active on the Indiana University campus from 1968 to 1971. Membership was restricted to graduate students and faculty members. The Bloomington group was just one chapter of a national group, based in Chicago, which had chapters on various college campuses throughout the United States. The group was active in a variety of causes and organized a number of events and campaigns to make their presence known on campus, such as a mock election for the Bloomington Chancellor to hosting a literature table where students could procure literature on the topics important to the NUC.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Collection is organized into two series: National organization records and Bloomington chapter records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection is organized into two series: National organization records and the Bloomington chapter records.

The first series consists of newsletters from the National organization as well as information about the organization's meetings and conferences. These help to get a sense of what the whole organization supported and what other schools' chapters did.

The second series contains the local Bloomington chapter's records. These include a wide variety of records that illustrate how the chapter tried to enact the changes the New University Conference supported and include newspaper articles, newsletters, proposals, letters, meeting agendas, and group promotional materials. The newspaper articles mainly focus on the campus wide Chancellor mock election organized by the New University Conference.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: 7 photographs transferred to the photograph collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related photographs may be available in the University Archives Photographs Database.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accessions: 99/051, Publications, Materials pulled from C268

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: The donor(s) of this collection have not transferred their copyrights for the materials to the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], New University Conference records, Collection C602, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: A large portion of the papers came from the files of the Office of the President and seemed to have been originally part of Collection C12, the Martha Vicinus papers. Direct correspondence to or from Vicinus were returned to C12, the remaining were pulled from the President's records and processed into this collection.
